Now you can implement range sliders and range selectors in your Plotly graphs with R!!!

```{r}
library(plotly)
library(quantmod)

# Download some data
getSymbols(Symbols = c("AAPL", "MSFT"))

ds <- data.frame(Date = index(AAPL), AAPL[,6], MSFT[,6])

plot_ly(ds, x = ~Date) %>%
  add_lines(y = ~AAPL.Adjusted, name = "Apple") %>% 
  add_lines(y = ~MSFT.Adjusted, name = "Microsoft") %>% 
  layout(
    title = "Stock Prices",
    xaxis = list(
      rangeselector = list(
        buttons = list(
          list(
            count = 3, 
            label = "3 mo", 
            step = "month",
            stepmode = "backward"),
          list(
            count = 6, 
            label = "6 mo", 
            step = "month",
            stepmode = "backward"),
          list(
            count = 1, 
            label = "1 yr", 
            step = "year",
            stepmode = "backward"),
          list(
            count = 1, 
            label = "YTD", 
            step = "year",
            stepmode = "todate"),
          list(step = "all"))),
      
      rangeslider = list(type = "date")),
    
    yaxis = list(title = "Price"))
```

```{r, echo = FALSE}
plotly_POST("r-range-selector-slider")
```
